Extended Shadow Types for margot

Source: R/margot-shadows-extended.R
create_truncation_shadow.Rd

This file implements additional shadow types for the margot package: truncation, coarsening, and mode effects shadows. Create a truncation shadow

Creates a shadow that truncates values outside specified bounds, simulating measurement instruments with limited ranges or administrative data thresholds.

Usage

create_truncation_shadow(
  variables,
  lower = -Inf,
  upper = Inf,
  type = c("simple", "boundary", "redistribute"),
  name = NULL
)

Arguments

variables

Character vector of variable names to truncate

lower

Numeric lower bound (default -Inf)

upper

Numeric upper bound (default Inf)

type

Character string: "simple" (values become NA), "boundary" (values pile up at limits), or "redistribute" (truncated mass redistributed to interior)

name

Optional name for the shadow

Value

A truncation shadow object

Examples

# create truncation shadow for lab equipment with range 0-300
truncate_cholesterol <- create_truncation_shadow(
  variables = "cholesterol",
  lower = 0,
  upper = 300,
  type = "simple"
)

# create truncation shadow for income top-coding
truncate_income <- create_truncation_shadow(
  variables = c("income_wave1", "income_wave2"),
  upper = 200000,
  type = "boundary"  # pile up at boundary
)
